commitResults.messageTitle: AK.java: Add AK class with greet and exit commands
commitResults.messageBody: Introduce the AK class as a central entry point for basic user interaction.\n\nImplement greet and exit commands to handle initial greeting and clean application termination.
Implement a REPL loop to echo user commands entered via standard input.\nDetect 'bye' command to terminate the application.
Add ability to store and list tasks using a fixed-size array.\nSupport 'list' to view tasks and 'bye' to exit.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Add Mark as Done functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce Task class to represent tasks with completion status.
Implement 'mark' and 'unmark' commands to toggle task status.
Update 'list' command to display task status icons ([X] or [ ]).
Refactor main loop to handle command parsing with arguments.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Add Todo, Deadline, and Event task types
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce specific task types inheriting from Task class.
Support 'todo', 'deadline', and 'event' commands.
Update parsing logic to handle /by, /from, and /to delimiters.
Refactor addTask to accept Task objects and confirm addition.
Create input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT in text-ui-test directory\nto enable regression testing using I/O redirection.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Add error handling and AkException class
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement AkException class to handle chatbot-specific errors.
Refactor processCommand to throw AkException for invalid inputs.
Catch AkException in main loop and display OOPS!!! error messages.
Handle cases: empty descriptions, invalid formats, unknown commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Add delete command and use ArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor task storage from fixed-size array to ArrayList.
Implement 'delete' command to remove tasks from the list.
Update add, list, mark, and unmark logic to work with ArrayList.
Add error handling for invalid delete index.
Update regression tests to include delete scenarios.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Use Command Enum and update AI.md
commitResults.messageBody: Refactor command processing logic to use Java Enums.\nReplace string literal commands with switch-case on Command enum.\nAdd detailed AI tool usage logs and observations to AI.md.

Implement Storage class to handle
file I/O operations.
Integrate Storage into AK.java to
load tasks on startup and save on
modification.
Update Task classes to include
toFileString() method for
formatting data.

commitResults.messageTitle: AK: Add DateTime support to Deadline and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgrade Deadline and Event classes
to use LocalDateTime.
Support input format yyyy-MM-dd
HHmm (e.g., 2019-12-01 1800).
Display dates with time in format
MMM d yyyy, h:mm a.

Refactor monolithic AK class into
specialized classes: Ui, Storage,
TaskList, Parser.
Implement Command Pattern with
abstract Command class and concrete
subclasses (AddCommand,
DeleteCommand, ExitCommand, etc.).
Decouple user interaction, logic,
and storage.

Structure classes into logical
packages under the ak.* namespace:
- ak.ui
- ak.task
- ak.command
- ak.storage
- ak.parser
- ak.exception
Update Runtest.bat to support
packaged compilation.

- Updated build.gradle:
    - Set main class to ak.AK.
    - Renamed output jar to ak.jar.
    - Configured Java toolchain to
strictly use Java 17.

- Added JUnit 5 test classes:
    - [ParserTest]
    - [DeadlineTest]
    - [TodoTest]
- Fixed test expectations to match
strict exception output and date
formatting.

- Updated Javadoc for
Ui.showWelcome() for better
clarity in addition to pre-existing
javadoc comments
- Created .vscode/settings.json to\nenforce project coding standards\nlocally.

- Added FindCommand to allow users to
search for tasks by keyword.
- Updated TaskList to include
find(keyword) method for filtering
tasks.
- Updated Parser to support the find
command.
- Updated Ui to display found tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Integrate Checkstyle and enforce coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
- Configure Gradle to use
Checkstyle plugin with provided
rules.
- Remove unused imports in
FindCommand and DeadlineTest.
- Fix indentation in Storage.java
to comply with Checkstyle (16
spaces for case).

Add FXML layouts and controllers
(MainWindow, DialogBox) for chat
UI.
- Refactor AK/Ui classes to support
GUI response capturing.
- Implement smart avatar cropping
(top-square) and circular clipping.

- Update printOutput to accept
variable arguments (String ...).
- Allow multiple messages to be
printed in a single shell.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Polish visuals with Royal Crimson and Gold accents
commitResults.messageBody: - Refine background and sizing logic in\nDialogBox.java.\n- Fix coding standard violations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser class: Extract constants for command strings
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser class uses magic strings for command keywords and
error messages. This makes the code harder to maintain and
prone to errors if the strings involve typos.

It also leads to long line lengths that violate the 120-character
limit.

Let's extract these strings into named constants. This improves
readability and ensures that command keywords are defined in
a single place.
It also ensures that long error messages are wrapped correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Classes: Add assertions to document assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Several classes rely on implicit assumptions about
the program state.
For example, Storage assumes the file path is valid,
and TaskList assumes indices are within bounds.

Java Assertions are a good way to document these
important assumptions explicitly in the code.

Let's add assertions to Storage, TaskList, and Ui to
verify:
- File path is not null/empty (Storage)
- Task index is within bounds (TaskList)
- Scanner is initialized (Ui)

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList class: Use Streams for filtering
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList currently uses an explicit loop to find
matching tasks.

Using Streams allows for a more declarative approach
to filtering. This makes the code more concise and
readable compared to the imperative loop style.

Let's refactor the find method to use Java Streams.
TaskList class: Use Streams for filtering
Branch A-Assertions
Parser class: Extract constants for command strings

Add a User Guide to the project documentation.

This documentation provides instructions on how to use the
chatbot.

It includes details on features like adding tasks, deleting
tasks, and finding tasks.
This helps new users understand how to interact with the
application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Refine a professional Game of Thrones themed User Guide
